recommendations: Axel Turn is a jump in which the skater rotates 360 degrees in the air, landing on the back foot.. For practicing Axel Turn as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Box jumps, Skater jumps, Plyometric lunges for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Begin in B-plus position., Swing arms forward, then up into crossed position., Jump off back foot, bringing legs into crossed position., Rotate 360 degrees, maintaining crossed leg position., Land on the back foot, bending knees to absorb impact. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.

Fish Roll and Flop is a movement where the dancer rolls their body in a fluid motion resembling the movement of a fish, while the Flop is a contemporary dance move where the dancer falls to the ground in a sudden and dramatic manner.. For practicing Fish Roll and Flop as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Cross-body shoulder stretch: Sit or stand with your feet hip-width apart. Reach one arm across your body, using your other arm to gently pull it towards your chest. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Thread the needle stretch: Begin on your hands and knees, then thread one arm through the space between your opposite arm and knee. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Reverse table-top pose: Sit on the ground with your hands behind you and your feet on the ground. Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, creating a table-top shape with your body. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then release. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and engage your core muscles for stability., Lift right shoulder up and back., Simultaneously lift left shoulder up and forward., Move right shoulder down and forward., Move left shoulder down and back, alternating continuously. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.

Pique Turn is a movement performed in the passé position while turning to the inside and  usually done in a series.. For practicing Pique Turn as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Plies with 10 repetitions, Tendus with 10 repetition on each side, Passe releves with 10 repetitions on each side for 5 repetitions on each side for 10 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Begin with your feet in first position, heels touching and toes pointing outward., Transfer your weight to your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground, pointing your toe and bringing it to the back of your left ankle., Push off your left foot and lift your right leg into a passé position, bringing your foot to the front of your left knee., As you turn, pivot on your left foot and bring your right leg around to the front in a pique position., As you complete the turn, land on your right foot with your left foot in a pique position. for 5 repetitions on each side for 10 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras: Work on your port de bras by practicing flowing arm movements, focusing on making smooth transitions and expressive gestures., Dance to different music: Explore different styles of music and try dancing to each one, focusing on expressing the mood and emotion of the music through your movements., Free movement improvisation: Let your body move freely and spontaneously, without any set choreography. Focus on expressing yourself through movement and exploring different levels and dynamics..
